required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of AZR-MD-001 in Patients With Meibomian Gland Dysfunction (MGD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Vehicle-controlled, Randomized Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacodynamics of AZR-MD-001 in Patients With Meibomian Gland Dysfunction (MGD)

brief_summary.textblock: AZ202001 is a multicenter study of AZR-MD-001 ointment and AZR-MD-001 vehicle in patients with Meibomian Gland Dysfunction (MGD)

detailed_description.textblock: AZ202001 is a multicenter, double-masked, vehicle-controlled, randomized, parallel group study evaluating the safety, efficacy and tolerability of AZR-MD-001 ointment and AZR-MD-001 vehicle in patients with Meibomian Gland Dysfunction (MGD)

primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in MGS. The MGS can range from 0 (highly abnormal) to 45 (Normal)

secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in MGYLS. The MGYLS can range from 0 (abnormal) to 15 (normal)
Change from Baseline in Total Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI). The Total OSDI can range from 0 (normal) to 100 (abnormal)

arm_group.description: AZR-MD-001 Vehicle will be dosed up to twice weekly.
AZR-MD-001 Active will be dosed up to twice weekly.

intervention.description: AZR-MD-001 is an active ophthalmic ointment
AZR-MD-001 is a vehicle ophthalmic ointment
intervention.other_name: AZR-MD-001 Vehicle is an ophthalmic ointment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female
- 18 years of age or older
- Best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA) of 20/40 or better (Snellen equivalent), using the logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution (LogMAR) in each eye
- Evidence of meibomian gland obstruction
- Reported dry eye signs and symptoms within the past 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled ocular disease (except for MGD and dry eye disease/keratoconjunctivitis sicca) or uncontrolled systemic disease
- Glaucoma, ocular hypertension, or intraocular pressure (IOP) in either eye at screening â‰¥24 mm Hg or has planned insertion/removal of glaucoma filtration shunts/devices during the study
- Corneal abnormality or disorder that impacts normal spreading of the tear film or corneal integrity
- BCVA worse than 20/40 in either eye
- Current use of punctal plugs, anticipated insertion during the study, or a history of punctal cautery in either eye

overall_official.affiliation: School of Optometry and Vision Science, University of New South Wales
